pr_title: Auto Query Fixer: Add Error classes to represent the BigQuery SQL errors.

timeline.message: Add a few error classes that represents the SQL errors from BigQuery.

timeline.bodyText: nit: not sure why the formatter starts new line again ==
timeline.author: kikkyo

replies.bodyText: Ah, I think the first line is almost 100 chars, so it should be a new line.
replies.author: mingen-pan

timeline.bodyText: nit: you can just use errorPostion - more readable and better practice.
timeline.author: kikkyo
kikkyo

replies.bodyText: I think they should be protected, because they will be directly accessed by the subclasses.
replies.author: mingen-pan

replies.bodyText: Hmm, after I rechecked the code, private should also work, I will change to private.
replies.author: mingen-pan

timeline.bodyText: nit: the auto formatting is really weird... :( For multiple options (1) and (2) just use new line
timeline.author: kikkyo

replies.bodyText: I think auto formatting does not handle it. Are you suggesting to put (1) and (2) in two different lines?
replies.author: mingen-pan

timeline.author: kikkyo

timeline.bodyText: nit: semantically it is clear the class is used to represent the errors, so you can just use "String tableName", "incorrectTableName" looks a bit redundant.
timeline.author: kikkyo

timeline.bodyText:
Does bigquery error return unrecognized name? or unrecognized column name?
If we meant to represent unrecognized column name, maybe using unrecognizedColumnName sounds more clear
timeline.author: kikkyo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,38 @@
+package com.google.cloud.bigquery.utils.queryfixer.errors;
+
+import com.google.cloud.bigquery.BigQueryException;
+import com.google.cloud.bigquery.utils.queryfixer.entity.Position;
+
+import lombok.Getter;
+
+/**
+ * A class to represent the "Unrecognized Name" errors. The unrecognized names here actually mean
+ * the unrecognized columns. The errors look like one of the two forms: (1) Unrecognized name:
+ * [column] at [x:y] or (2) Unrecognized name: [column]; Did you mean [suggestion]? at [x:y], where
+ * [column] is the incorrect column, [suggestion] is one of the correct column candidates, and [x:y]
+ * is the row and column numbers.
+ */
+@Getter
+public class UnrecognizedNameError extends BigQuerySemanticError {

replies.bodyText:
It returns "Unrecognized name" but it only refers to column.
I will change the Class to UnrecognizedColumnError
replies.author: mingen-pan

timeline.bodyText: nit: unrecognizedName -> columnName if we meant it for columnName
timeline.author: kikkyo

timeline.message: refactor the code based on review

timeline.bodyText: Sorry for the nit comments... but why there would be new lines in between :D? similar with the above.
timeline.author: kikkyo

replies.bodyText:
After trying a few times of the auto format, I figure out I need to apply the auto format on each page. Thus, the old version is not formatted.
I check the style guide, I think having a new line is encouraged.
https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s7.1.1-javadoc-multi-line
replies.author: mingen-pan

timeline.author: kikkyo

 import lombok.Getter;

- * [function] is the incorrect function, [suggestion] is one of the correct function candidates, and [x:y] is the row
- * and column numbers. */

+ * A class to represent the "Function Not Found" errors. The errors look like one of the two forms:
